meanings.definition: The quality or state of being juvenile.
meanings.sent1: Her constant laughter and playful nature showed her juvenilities.
meanings.sent2: The park was filled with the juvenilities of children running and playing.
meanings.sent3: The teacher couldn't help but smile at the students' endearing juvenilities.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of life, the blossoming flowers symbolize the juvenilities of youth.
meanings.sent5: The innocence and joy of childhood are captured in the juvenilities of their games.

meanings.definition: Behaviors or characteristics typical of youth.
meanings.sent1: The energy and enthusiasm of the team reflected the juvenilities of youth.
meanings.sent2: His love for adventure and exploration showcased his juvenilities.
meanings.sent3: The siblings' playful banter highlighted their shared juvenilities.
meanings.sent4: The vibrant colors and carefree spirit of the painting captured the juvenilities of youth.
meanings.sent5: The song lyrics resonated with the universal juvenilities of growing up and discovering the world.

meanings.sent1: His constant pranks and jokes often bordered on juvenilities.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't tolerate his juvenile behavior and constant juvenilities.
meanings.sent3: The office meeting turned into a display of unprofessional juvenilities.
meanings.sent4: The political debate was marred by personal attacks and juvenilities.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the consequences of clinging to juvenilities instead of embracing maturity.
